title.narrative: Nutritional support to drought-affected people in Faryab province

description.narrative: This project aims to respond to nutrition needs for Faryab drought-prone province. The overall objective of the action is reducing the incidence of mortality and morbidity related to acute malnutrition in children aged 0 to 59 months and pregnant and lactating women in drought-affected districts of Faryab province by improving their nutritional status through access to therapeutic and targeted supplementary feeding programs. The program will be implemented in Almar, Bilcheragh, Dowlat Abad and Pashtoon Kot districts of Faryab province. The proposed action will achieve this objective, by addressing acute malnutrition amongst children under five-year-old and pregnant and lactating women, through scale up the coverage of Integrated Malmanagement of Acute Malnutrition (IMAM) services and increasing the access through community outreach by Mobile Nutrition Teams (MNTs). Through this project, AADA intends to undertake the following key interventions: In Faryab: Currently, there are 28 active BPHS Health Facilities (HFs) including 7 Comprehensive Health Center (CHCs) 9 Basic Health Centers (BHCs) and 12 Health Sub-Centers in target districts. Outpatient Department of Severe Acute Malnutrition (OPD-SAM) service is providing through all CHCs and BHCs, but Outpatient Department of Moderate Acute Malnutrition (OPD-MAM) is not available in any of them. Through this action, AADA will establish OPD-MAM in all 7 CHCs and 9 BHCs and both OPD-SAM and OPD-MAM services in 12 HSCs. Taking into account the extra staff workload in the HSCs and BHCs, there is a need to have one additional female nurse to be recruited and trained for each HSC and BHC (separate from MoPH staff establishment) to provide nutritional cares to the targeted beneficiaries. Takhar: Moreover, two MNTs will be deployed in Belcheragh and Dawlat Abad districts. The MNTs will provide OPD-SAM and MAM services for the management of acutely malnourished boys and girls (6 to 59 months) and pregnant lactating women in remote communities living in more than 3 hours walk from the nearest HFs. Each MHNT will comprise a team of professionals, including a male nurse (in charge of the team), a midwife or female nurse. The mobile teams will be located in the districts and will function from there. Breastfeeding corners will be established in 12 HSCs and nine BHCs of Faryab and will manage by a female nurse to provide IYCF-E to mothers having 0-23 months children. AADA is currently present in Faryab provinces providing BPHS services having access to entire population including drought-affected districts prioritized in this call. The proposed action will target 73,207 direct beneficiaries including 24,285 women and 26,389 girls. AADA will implement this project in coordination with all relevant actors at the national, provincial and communities.
